summary.p: Collection of mostly late antique texts, many illustrated, on geography and the administration of the late Roman Empire, almost all copied in 1436 from a Carolingian volume then preserved in the cathedral library of Speyer (now destroyed), itself deriving from a late antique original.

msContents.textLang: Latin; item 14 in Latin and Greek

msItem.note: Double-page illuminated frontispiece.
Fol. 2v blank.

msItem.title: Cosmographia
msItem.note: Lacuna at end, inherited from exemplar
Pr. Geographi latini minores,ed. A. Riese (1878), pp. 71–103.

msItem.title: Itinerarium prouinciarum Antonini Augusti
msItem.note: Pr. Itinerarium Antonini Augusti et Hierosolymitanum, ed. G. Parthey and M. Pinder (1848).
Lists of the hills and aqueducts of the City of Rome:

msItem.author: Dicuil
msItem.title: Liber de mensura orbis terrae
msItem.note: Pr. Dicuili Liber de mensura orbis terrae, ed. J. J. Tierney (Dublin, 1967)
Texts on the provinces:

msItem.title: Notitia Galliarum
msItem.note: Pr. Notitia Dignitatum, ed. O. Seeck (1876), pp. 261–74

msItem.title: Laterculus Polemii Siluii
msItem.note: Pr. Notitia Dignitatum, ed. O. Seeck (1876), pp. 254–60

msItem.title: De montibus, portis et uiis urbis Romae

msItem.note: Fols. 66rb-66v blank.

msItem.title: De rebus bellicis
msItem.note: Pr. Anonymi auctoris De rebus bellicis, R. I. Ireland (Teubner, 1984)

msItem.title: Disputatio siue Altercatio Hadriani Augusti et Epicteti Philosophi
msItem.note: Altercatio Hadriani Augusti et Epicteti philosophi, ed. L. W. Daly and W. Suchier (1939).

msItem.title: Notitia, siue Libellus de regionibus, urbis Romae
Notitia urbis Constantinopolitanae
msItem.note: Pr. Notitia Dignitatum, ed. Seeck, pp. 230–43.

msItem.title: De gradibus cognationum
msItem.note: Pr. Corpus Iuris Romani Anteiustiniani, ed. E. Böcking et al. (1835), p. 173.

msItem.title: Notitia dignitatum omnium tam ciuilium quam militarium
msItem.note: Pr. Notitia Dignitatum, ed. Seeck, pp. 1–225.

msItem.title: Demensuratio suie de mensuratione provinciarum
msItem.note: Added text. Title in Pietro Donato’s own hand, 'Demensuratio prouinciarum, que non erat in precedenti codice, sed de antiquissimo libro excerpta.' – i.e. not from the Codex Spirensis but from another 9th-century manuscript, now surviving as Oxford, Merton College MS. 315.
Pr. Geographi latini minores, pp. 9–14.

msItem.author: Gregory Nazianzus
msItem.title: De VII mundi spectaculis
msItem.note: An extract from the original Greek, with Latin translation by Cyriaco d'Ancona, both in Cyriaco’s hand with headings in green ink, and here dedicated to Pietro Donato though elsewhere to other patrons.
Fol. 173v blank.

handDesc.handNote: Humanistic script. The same scribe also copied a Terence at Basel in 1436, perhaps also for Pietro Donato (MS. Vat. Ottob. lat. 1368), with miniatures also by Peronet Lamy (see below).

decoDesc.decoNote: Important miniatures, after a Carolingian copy of a late antique MS., by Peronet Lamy. Fine initials. (Pächt and Alexander i. 666 and ii. 599, pls. LII and LVI)

origin.origPlace: Produced at Switzerland, Basel; miniatures by a French artist, script and initials by an Italian (perhaps Paduan) scribe.

history.provenance: Copied for Pietro Donato, at the council of Basel, 1436, from the 'Codex Spirensis', a Carolingian copy, preserved in the cathedral library at Speyer, of a late antique manuscript. Fol. 170: 'Exemplata est hec Cosmographia quę Scoti dicitur cum picturis ex uetustissimo Codice. quem habui ex Spirensi bibliotheca. Anno domini .M.CCCCXXXVI. mense Ianuario. Dum ego Petrus donatus dei pacientia episcopus paduanus uice Sanctissimi domini Eugenij paper .iiij. Generali Basiliensi Concilio pręsiderem'.
No. 209 in the inventory of Donato's books (P. Sambin, 'La bibliotheca di Pietro Donato (1380–1447)', Bolletino del Museo Civico di Padua 48 (1959), 53–98. His annotations throughout the volume.

recordHist.source: Adapted (2018) from descriptions by B. Barker-Benfield (2014), Watson, and Pächt and Alexander (see bibliography). Previously described in the Quarto Catalogue (H. O. Coxe, Catalogi codicum manuscriptorum Bibliothecæ Bodleianæ pars tertia codices Græcos et Latinos Canonicianos complectens, Quarto Catalogues III, 1854). Quarto Catalogue, cols. 719–20 Summary Catalogue, vol. 4, p. 407

availability.p: To ensure its preservation, access to this item is restricted, and readers are asked to work from reproductions and published descriptions as far as possible. If you wish to apply to see the original, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant curator outlining the subject of your research, the importance of this item to that research, and the resources you have already consulted.

listBibl.bibl: A. G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c.435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford, 1984), no. 336
Otto Pächt and J. J. G. Alexander, Illuminated Manuscripts in the Bodleian Library, Oxford, I (1966), no. 666, and II (1970), no. 599

ref.title: Pinakes | Πίνακες: Textes et manuscrits grecs
